Description: Rim sherd (mended from two fragments and added plaster) of Chian pottery Type B kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black (fired brown, traces remaining) below; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The letter A or a triangle is written in pencil on the interior surface. The sherd probably belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201.777. Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis (Williams 1983, 169). Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 168, no. 113)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 724, no. 838)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1773) (phase 2)
